did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Appointment and Commission of Samuel W. Cozzens, 1860
did.abstract: A provisional government organized April 2, 1860, for Southern New Mexico then including Arizona. Lewis S. Owings was installed as governor on April 4th. Appointment and commission by L.S. Owings, governor of the provisional government of the Territory of Arizona of Samuel W. Cozzens, judge of the first judicial district, done at Tucson on the 5th day of April, 1860.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Provisional government organized April 2, 1860, for Southern New Mexico then including Arizona. Lewis S. Owings was installed as governor on April 4th.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Appointment and commission by L.S. Owings, governor of the provisional government of the Territory of Arizona of Samuel W. Cozzens, judge of the first judicial district... Done at Tucson...5th day of April, 1860. Contains autographs of L.S. Owings and James P. Lucas.

item.corpname: Arizona. District Court (1st Judicial District, Pima County)
